bug.short_desc: provide a manpage for distributions that ship a standalone ecj binary

long_desc.thetext:
Created attachment 231289 Proposed ecj manpage
Many distributions package JDT core libraries, with an independent executable for ecj. Each of these must currently maintain a manpage, if they want one. Since it is unlikely that the documentation for ecj would differ widely across distributions, it would be great if this could instead be maintained upstream. Attached is proposed first cut, based on most current debian release but updated to reflect the output of -help (ie usage message) from eclipse compiler as of 4.2.1.
Manoj, see if we can accommodate this for 4.4.

Created attachment 241893 First cut - wip
early comments welcome - yet to do the formatting completely - work in progress
Manoj, where does this file go in the repository and how does this get into ecj.jar? Eventually this should be accessible through the ecj.jar, right?

(In reply to Jayaprakash Arthanareeswaran from comment #3) > Manoj, where does this file go in the repository and how does this get into > ecj.jar? Eventually this should be accessible through the ecj.jar, right?
You are right, it has to be accessible through ecj.jar when somebody downloads this jar file. I would put it in the same place as where about.html is present, which is the top level directory. Don't think it is necessary to create another doc directory for this file alone. Anybody who inflates this can append the installed path to the MANPATH to access this file or can invoke man command directly on this file.
Glanced over the patch and looks good to me for a first cut. One suggestion for the -warn options is insert '-' between the option name and description would make it bit more readable.

(In reply to Jayaprakash Arthanareeswaran from comment #5) > Glanced over the patch and looks good to me for a first cut. One suggestion > for the -warn options is insert '-' between the option name and description > would make it bit more readable.
Thanks for the review Jay. Regarding the suggestion, this may not be "generally accepted format" as you can see from the man pages of some compiler, say gcc.

Created attachment 242904 Updated patch
Patch looks good. I suggest we add the man page to ecjsrc.jar also, as there would be users who generate the binary from the source.
Manoj, if you are fine with this change, please go ahead and release.

Thanks Jay for the comments. Modified the attachment to add ecj.1 to ecj_all.jar as well; changed released via commit : http://git.eclipse.org/c/jdt/eclipse.jdt.core.git/commit/?id=4f901fe3de947c74ca2787a4145c32a7e9bb6549
tycho no longer uses this patch - need to update pom.xml - reopening to add these entries in pom

(In reply to Manoj Palat from comment #10) > tycho no longer uses this patch - need to update pom.xml - reopening to add > these entries in pom
Resolved via commit: http://git.eclipse.org/c/jdt/eclipse.jdt.core.git/commit/?id=ebd2e541dccf34486b951e618d8a5e9dbb85ac52
Shankha, please verify this when the next RC2 build becomes available. Thanks
Verified for 4.4 RC1 using I20140519-2000 build.
